snippet.textDisplay: The last console I owned was an snes... great console, but I'm part of the PC master race now. I'd really like to see more console games on PC personally. Many would do really well on steam I think.
snippet.textOriginal: The last console I owned was an snes... great console, but I'm part of the PC master race now. I'd really like to see more console games on PC personally. Many would do really well on steam I think.

snippet.textDisplay: +Fernando Davalos I'm just kidding obviously. However the "PC master race" meme does refer to the hardware, not the games. Tons of fantastic games on console platforms. Many of which are under represented on PC.
snippet.textOriginal: +Fernando Davalos I'm just kidding obviously. However the "PC master race" meme does refer to the hardware, not the games. Tons of fantastic games on console platforms. Many of which are under represented on PC.

snippet.textDisplay: You call yourself a "master race", but then you turn around and ask for console games?

snippet.textDisplay:
Lead Designer: So, what should we name the project? 
Lazy Designer: Why do we have to? 
Lead Designer: Because idiot, our game needs a na - EXACTLY, WHY! 
**Thus, the Ys series was born.**
snippet.textOriginal:
Lead Designer: So, what should we name the project? 
Lazy Designer: Why do we have to? 
Lead Designer: Because idiot, our game needs a na - EXACTLY, WHY! 
**Thus, the Ys series was born.**

snippet.textDisplay: As a fairly new fan of this series, I'm looking forward to playing the new Ys: Memories of Celceta once I get a Vita. It'd be great to have a PC port though so everyone can play it through Steam, it's the main reason I got to really try this series out.
snippet.textOriginal: As a fairly new fan of this series, I'm looking forward to playing the new Ys: Memories of Celceta once I get a Vita. It'd be great to have a PC port though so everyone can play it through Steam, it's the main reason I got to really try this series out.

snippet.textDisplay: Sony getting so many of the titles only on the Vita has made me hate software exclusivity for consoles more than ever.  I'm not buying your hardware I don't need or want to have software available to me.

snippet.textDisplay:
@***** Honestly, I haven't played any other Y's games besides Memories of Celceta, but I have I and II on Steam just waiting to be played XD 

Some of the bosses in MoC kicked my ass multiple times, but the curve is fair. Patience is a virtue when it comes to this game.

snippet.textDisplay: Gahhh don't remind me, after playing all the Ys games available on Steam but knowing there are so many more out there that I can't play without a Vita, I was left so empty.

snippet.textDisplay: I really like this song.  I would recommend listening to the OST for Ys IV: Dawn of Ys.  I really enjoyed listening to it last year and I think you would enjoy it, Gabe.  Just warning you: it was fairly difficult to find a complete playlist for it on Youtube.  If you are able to find it, kudos to you as it is easily one of the best soundtracks for its time in terms of sound quality.
snippet.textOriginal: I really like this song.  I would recommend listening to the OST for Ys IV: Dawn of Ys.  I really enjoyed listening to it last year and I think you would enjoy it, Gabe.  Just warning you: it was fairly difficult to find a complete playlist for it on Youtube.  If you are able to find it, kudos to you as it is easily one of the best soundtracks for its time in terms of sound quality.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Hey Supra as always you have the hearing of a true lover of videogame music! I haven't played this game but know a little of it. Out of curiosity, are you a pc gamer also? if so, can you recommend me some good JRPG games for Steam or no-steam games too? Thank you in advance! and keep the awesome job with the soundtracks!
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky Hey Supra as always you have the hearing of a true lover of videogame music! I haven't played this game but know a little of it. Out of curiosity, are you a pc gamer also? if so, can you recommend me some good JRPG games for Steam or no-steam games too? Thank you in advance! and keep the awesome job with the soundtracks!

snippet.textDisplay:
You'll like Memories of Celceta.

Extremely fun and quite challenging on harder difficulties.
snippet.textOriginal:
